title: María C. Sánchez Linares
text:
About me
I am data science and economics student largely interested in solving social and economic problems with data-based solution. I have coursework Data Analysis and Visualization, Machine Learning, Statistical Modeling, Environmental and Economic Policy. I have a foundation in data-driven research and am looking for opportunities to get hands-on work experience. I have a passion for social justice, and blending my expertise, I aim to leverage data to inform innovative solutions to real-world challenges in the business and policy-making realms.

title: María C. Sánchez Linares
text:
Personal
I was born and raised in Valencia, Venezuela. At the age of 18, I received a United World College scholarship to attend UWC Red Cross Nordic in Flekke, Norway. After finishing the International Baccalaureate diploma, I moved to Saint Paul, MN to start my undergraduate studies at Macalester College.
I find joy in embracing new adventures and experiences. I am not your typical outdoors enthusiast, but I like skiing and kayaking. I also enjoy exploring new flavors through food touring and baking.
Most recently, I am preparing for my next journey. I have always loved traveling, and I am excited to be studying abroad in Málaga, Spain come spring 2024.

title: CV
text:
Experience

Using Data to Solve Economic Problem | PREDOC & Opportunity Insights  Student Intern | Summer 2023  — Conducted an empirical research project as part of the PREDOC program, under the guidance of Prof. Bruich from the Harvard University Department of Economics, participating in classes and weekly advisory meetings.  — Used STATA to manipulate large datasets, designed and analyzed multiple empirical models through qualitative research and statistical modeling techniques, deriving meaningful insights into the effects of highway proximity on social mobility.  — Summarized results through a written report, various plots, tables, and graphs.  — Chosen as one of the 5 best students out of 50 to present my research findings at a conference hosted by the Federal Reserve Board of Governors.
Data Justice Academy | University of Virginia School of Data Science  Research Fellow | Summer 2023  — Conducted qualitative, quantitative and historical research on transgender people health disparities.  — Analyzed different data collection methods and developed a comprehensive literature review on the invisibility and misrepresentation of transgender people in official statistics.  — Employed R tools to curate a list of all federally supported survey data and created dynamic data visualizations displaying the proportion of surveys collecting specific information across different SOGI areas.
Undergraduate Teacher Assistantship | Macalester College  Student Preceptor | Spring 2023 — Fall 2023  Introduction to Data Science and Financial Accounting Preceptor  — Facilitate learning by assisting students to meet personal and course objectives through weekly office hours for three Intro to Data Science and two Financial Accounting sections.  — Grade and provide feedback to over 60 students on a weekly basis.

title: CV
text:
Leadership & Civic Engagement

Adelante! Latinx Student Organization | Macalester College  President & Treasurer | August 2021 — Present  — Organized and executed numerous events, including cultural celebrations, panel discussions, and workshops, attracting a thriving membership base of over 80 students.  — Procured Racial Justice Project Fund $5,000 grant to hold workshops and a photo exhibition on Afro-Latinx experiences for the advancement of racial justice at Macalester College.  — Collaborated with other student organizations to create culturally diverse events, promoting cross-cultural understanding and cooperation and building community.
Starr Hill Pathways | Macalester College  Student Mentor | Summer 2023  — Provided guidance and support to 30 middle school students during Intro to Sport Analytics workshops at a career exploration program that seeks to address the lack of diversity in STEM Careers.  — Expanded the program’s curriculum to incorporate the achievements and perspectives of female athletes, enriching the students’ educational experience through the design of a new workshop.
